[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Person Management System (PMS) defines requirements for managing attributes, encapsulation, and financial tracking.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: PMS supports personal data storage, controlled access, and financial computation of income and expenses.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: PMS integrates with financial databases for income tracking, expense categorization, and report generation.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: PMS provides web-based dashboards for managing financial records.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: PMS operates on personal computing devices with secure authentication.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: PMS supports APIs for financial data exchange and external integration.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: PMS ensures secure transmission using HTTPS protocols.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: PMS optimizes storage for personal attributes and financial records.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: PMS ensures 24/7 access with scheduled maintenance and data backups.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: PMS supports multi-user roles with customizable access settings.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: PMS links to document repositories for financial record storage.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: PMS facilitates attribute management, financial tracking, and secure access control.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: PMS serves individuals tracking finances and organizations managing user profiles.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: PMS depends on internet connectivity, financial data sources, and external APIs.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: PMS requires authentication services, financial APIs, and secure document storage.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with financial databases for income and expense tracking.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall securely connect to external authentication providers.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall manage personal attributes, including name, age, and gender (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall enforce controlled access to attributes using public operations (REQ-DSGN-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall compute income and expenses based on stored financial data (REQ-DB-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an interactive dashboard for managing financial records.
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The system shall display financial summaries in an intuitive format.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process financial calculations without significant delay.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall retrieve user data instantly.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall securely store user attributes, income, and expenses (REQ-FUNC-001, REQ-FUNC-003, REQ-INTF-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall enforce encapsulation for attributes and financial data.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with personal data protection regulations.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall log modifications to attributes and financial records (REQ-DB-001, REQ-DSGN-001).

[SEC] 3. Verification: Verification includes security validation, access control tests, financial computation accuracy, and API response evaluation.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals cover attribute management, financial tracking, authentication, API integration, and compliance procedures.
[SEC] 5. References: Data protection and financial compliance standards.
